titleStmt.title: Telegram from John M. Burke to John H. Tait, May 24, 1914
titleStmt.author: Burke, John M., c. 1873-1940

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Burke, John M., c. 1873-1940
bibl.title: Telegram from John M. Burke to John H. Tait

msIdentifier.repository: McCracken Research Library, John H. Tait collection

div1.note:
Form I T. W.
The Great North Western Telegraph Company Of Canada
Connecting With The Western Union Telegraph Company
24,000 Offices In North America. Cable Service To All The World.
This company Transmits and Delivers messages only on conditions limiting its liability, which have been assented to by the sender of the following message. Errors can be guarded against only be repeating a message back to the sending station for comparison, and the Company will not hold itself liable for errors or delays in the transmission or delivery of Unrepeated Messages, beyond the amount of tolls paid thereon, or in any case where the claim is not presented in writing within sixty days after the message is filed with the Company for transmission. This is an Unrepeated Message, and is delivered by request of the sender, under the conditions named above.
Z. A. Lash, President, Toronto, Ont.
Geo. D. Perry, General Manager
E. Boening, Superintendent, Seattle, Wn.
Received at 516 Hastings Street West, Vancouver, B. C.
Telephone 5880-5881

address.addrLine: Care Sells Floto Circus Vancouver BC

div1.p: Get todays Seattle Post Intelligencer see notice and look sporting page for Colonel Fred and Jackson get variety for Pehaska See show depression all over send me half dozen route lists Butler Hotel Seattle
div1.note:
Always Open.
Money Transferred by Telegraph.
Cable Office.
